intro: Tetracera fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
